Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a form of government censorship on free speech.
Fining tech companies for allowing dissenting views is likened to 'Big Brother' control.
The use of fact-checkers to remove posts is viewed as a threat to freedom of speech and thought.
The legislation is compared to authoritarian practices, reducing individual rights similar to those in Communist China.
Notable Quotes: Fining tech companies for allowing their clients to question the government or hold a different view from the mainstream narrative smacks of Big Brother.
Allowing fact checkers (Qualifications please) to take down the posts of those who disagree with opinions of others, removes freedom of speech and thought.
Breaking of the Nuremburg Code, lockdowns, mandates, etc, have reduced us to no better than Communist China.
